name: Law, public safety and security test

questions.question: All contracts require which of the following?
The execution of a will must be witnessed by...
To open a business in illinois, you must incorporate.
If you are bitten by a dog, the owner is liable for your injuries unless you...
options: Jumped over the fence to pet the dog

questions.question: You can go to jail if file your tax return but you don't pay the bill.
Which Section of the Indian Evidence Act is related with doctrine of ‘Res ipsa loquitor’ ?
In context of the exception of grave and sudden provocation, which of the following is correct
options: Provocation should not be voluntarily provoked by the offender
Lawful exercise of the right of private defence does not give provocation
Lawful exercise of powers by a public servant in obedience to the law does not amount to provocation

questions.question: Of the following, who may officially propose a bill?
When a congress member agrees to propose legislation on behalf of constituents, interest groups etc., (s)he becomes a
If a sponsor is a member of the House of Representatives, (s)he would give the bill to the __________ ___ ___ _________, after which the bill would be further processed.
Based on the issues addressed in a bill, a bill will be recommended to a particular _______________ and placed on its calendar.
If a committee chairperson doesn't act upon a bill
options: The bill remains on file until further notice
Another member of the committee may act
The bill is recommended to a different committee

questions.question: In committee or subcommittee review, views of the executive branch and other public officials and experts are put on the record.  These are known as
After hearings are held, subcommittees may make changes to a bill or "_____________" the bill
In order to proceed from subcommittee review to committee action, a subcommittee must
If a full committee voes to "order the bill reported", the bill proceeds to
options: Endure further hearings and mark ups

questions.question: Which officer(s) of the house has/have the most influence in determining the scheduling of a bill on the house floor?
options: Speaker of the house & majority leader

questions.question: Once a bill reaches the floor of a particular chamber, members vote on rules regarding
What is "unanimous consent"?
options: A bill is rejected by all members of a particular chamber
A bill is passed by all members of a particular chamber
A bill is voted on without debate
Both chambers agree to hear a bill

questions.question: When the house or senate passes a bill, it is referred to the other chamber which may do all of the following except
options: Refer the bill to the executive

questions.question: The formation of a conference committee becomes necessary when
options: The 2nd house significantly alters the bill
The 2nd house makes minor changes to the bill
